main event: A bright light, reportedly twice as bright as a street lamp, was observed in Findlay, Ohio for 1 hour and 40 minutes on March 29, 1966.
interesting points: The witness noted that the light was so bright it was difficult to discern details,The light changed colors during the observation,The object remained stationary for the entire time,The conclusion drawn by investigators was that the sighting was likely of Venus,No physical evidence or photographs were found from the sighting.
witness description: a teacher, Mr. David N. Dunham
